messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web backend projects. Your task is to examine a specific web backend project, identify its primary programming language and primary development framework. I'll provide you the output of the `ls` command, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

```
config
controllers
data
middleware
models
routes
seeder.js
server.js
utils
```

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
- Primary programming language: JavaScript (running on Node.js, using ES module syntax)
- Primary development framework: Express.js

Why:
- server.js imports and uses Express (line: import express from 'express'; app.use(...); app.listen(...)), which is the web framework that wires routes and middleware.
- routes/*.js files use express.Router() and export Express route handlers (e.g., routes/productRoutes.js).
- controllers implement route logic and are wired into the Express routes (e.g., controllers/productController.js).
- models use mongoose (import mongoose from 'mongoose'; mongoose.Schema...) showing MongoDB ODM usage â€” typical in Node/Express backends.
- Other Node/Express indicators: cookie-parser import, dotenv, middleware folder, seeder.js, and import/export module syntax throughout.

Together these files show a Node.js backend built with the Express framework (and Mongoose for data models).
